description: Team Leidos are proud to be delivering the logistics commodities and services transformation (LCS(T)) Delivery partner contracts (LCS (T)/0001 dated 16 April 2015) on behalf of the UK Ministry of Defence (the 'Prime Contract'). Delivery of other parts of the LCS(T) contract are delivered by Leidos Europe Ltd (LEL) and other partners (together 'Team Leidos').Team Leidos wishes to stimulate interest, information and views across the market for the fulfilment of this requirement via this PIN.This prior information notice is not a means to submit a formal expression of interest in respect of any potential tender. Any resultant requirement will be subject to the EU Public Procurement Regulations and respective advertising action.Please note all information provided to organisations or individuals that respond to this notice should be treated as confidential, and not shared further without express written permission from Leidos Supply Ltd.

tender.title: The Supply of Shirts

classification.description: Clothing, footwear, luggage articles and accessories

tender.description: Team Leidos would like to make interested suppliers aware that it intends to tender for the Supply of Shirts to the Armed Forces (and Ministry of Defence Police).The requirement consists of long and short sleeved shirts in various colours and sizes, and will include some flame retardant shirts. In total, the requirement will consist of circa 515 NSN's (types of Shirt).The framework length will not exceed 4 years, and is anticipated to commence in early 2022.The value of this framework is estimated to be between GBP 1 million to GBP 2 million across a 4 year period.

lots.description: An industry day is likely to be held in late January 2021 (date TBC), giving suppliers the opportunity to view the items that will form the requirement, and to ask any questions of the Team Leidos project team. In the meantime, any suppliers responding to this PIN will receive further information about the requirement in due course.Interested parties should contact Ceri Williams (ceri.williams@leidos.com)

address.streetAddress: Monarch Court, 8 The Brooms, Emersons Green

classification.description: Agricultural, farming, fishing, forestry and related products
Agricultural, farming, fishing, forestry and related products
